translation:
n. 习惯，习性; 气质; 宗教服装
vt. 给…穿衣服; 打扮

时态：habited, habiting, habits
分布：习惯(96%)，习性(4%)


→来自古法语habit,衣服，行为，习惯，来自拉丁语habere,持，握，拥有，来自ghabh,持，握，抓住，词源同give,gift.引申词义居住，养成的习惯，及特指与宗教相关的袍子，道服等。
习惯(住一个地方→习惯了)[habit=dwell,表示"居住"]
n.习惯,习性,脾性It is not easy to break off a bad habit.要改掉一个坏习惯不容易.



noun REPEATED ACTION  重复的行为   ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■something which you do often and regularly, sometimes without knowing that you are doing it 习惯
•I always buy the same brand of toothpaste just out of (= because of) habit.我出于习惯总是买同一个牌子的牙膏。

•I'm trying not to get into (= start) the habit of always having biscuits with my coffee.我尽量避免养成喝咖啡时总是吃饼干的习惯。

•I used to swim twice a week, but I seem to have got out of (= ended) the habit recently.我过去每周游两次泳，但最近似乎打破了这个习惯。

•I was taught to drive by my boyfriend and I'm afraid I've picked up (= caught) some of his bad habits.我跟我的男友学开车，恐怕我已经染上了他的一些坏习惯。

•His eating habits are extraordinary.他的饮食习惯很不寻常。

•I'm trying to get him to break (= end intentionally) the habit of switching on the TV when he comes home at night.我设法让他改掉晚上一回家就打开电视的习惯。

•I don't mind being woken up once or twice in the middle of the night by my flatmate so long as she doesn't make a habit of it (= do it frequently).我不介意半夜里被室友吵醒一两次，只要她不经常这样就行。

•I'm not really in the habit of looking at (= I don't usually look at) other people's clothes, but even I noticed that awful suit!我没有观察别人穿着的习惯，可是就连我都注意到了那身难看的套装！
countable ■something annoying that someone often does 坏习惯，毛病
•She has a  habit of finishing off other people's sentences.她有打断别人说话的坏习惯。
countable ■a strong physical need to keep having a particular drug 毒瘾
•a cocaine habit古柯碱毒瘾

•figurative humorous I'm afraid I've got a chocolate habit.恐怕我巧克力吃上瘾了。

['hæb.ɪt] noun CLOTHING  衣服  countable ■a special piece of long clothing worn by monks and nuns （僧侣或修女穿的）衣服，长袍




habit, practice, tradition, convention, usage, manners, custom

这组词都有“习惯，风俗，传统”的意思，其区别是：
habit: 侧重于自然养成的，不易去掉的个人习惯。
practice: 常指习惯性的做法或行为。
tradition: 广义指世代相传的伦理、行为规范和生活方式，特指因长久奉行而几乎具有法律效力的习惯、习俗，侧重历史意义。
convention: 多指约定俗成的行为方式规则或公认的标准，或指艺术上公认的技巧。
usage: 指持续时间长，为很多人公认采纳的惯例、习俗。
manners: 指在某一时期或某一团体中盛行的社会礼仪或社会风俗模式。
custom: 指一个国家、一个民族、一个地区或一个社会的习惯、行为方式或风俗习惯。也可指个人的习惯。


n. 习惯， [生物] 习性；嗜好
 - manner, custom, behaviour, weakness, way
vt. 使穿衣
 - attire
examples: 英 ['hæbɪt] 美 ['hæbɪt]
n.习惯；习性

(1) He is in the habit of rising early.(2) I have to bear with his bad habit.(3) My colleague has broken off the habit of smoking.(4) He has a habit of sunbathe for two hours a day.(5) The honeysuckle has a twining habit.
(1) 他有早起的习惯。(2) 我不得不忍受他的坏习惯。(3) 我的同事已经戒掉了吸烟的习惯。(4) 他习惯每天做两小时日光浴。(5) 忍冬有盘绕的习性。
[sound:youdao-5b55fe40-51d84c38-be56ee8a-b7bb910f-b6e94844.mp3]

translation:
adj. 习惯的; 惯常的; 习以为常的

分布：习惯的(62%)，惯常的(38%)


→来自habit,习惯。
惯常的(habit+ual)[habit=dwell,表示"居住"]



adjective slightly formal ■usual or repeated 通常的；习惯性的
•a habitual thief惯窃

•habitual drug use吸毒成瘾

•dressed in his habitual black身穿他惯常的黑色衣服

•her habitual meanness她一贯的卑劣行为





usual, habitual, regular, conventional, customary

这组词都有“通常的，惯常的”的意思，其区别是：
usual: 普通用词，概念广泛。指经常发生或意料中的事，既可指自然发生的现象，也可指按个人习惯或惯例而做的事。
habitual: 指按个人习惯反复发生的事情。侧重经常性、习惯性。
regular: 着重遵守约定俗成的规则。
conventional: 语气强，指遵守已成习惯的事情，强调符合惯例，由人们普遍认可。
customary: 指特定的个人或群体的平常习惯，或习俗性的行为。


adj. 习惯的；惯常的；习以为常的
 - used, frequent, confirmed
examples: 英 [hə'bɪtʃuəl] 美 [hə'bɪtʃuəl]
adj.惯常的；习惯的

(1) Farmers are habitual early risers.(2) His habitual place at the table was occupied by a stranger.(3) In fact, this movement by itself was habitual.(4) Her pride was hurt, but her habitual control of manner helped her.
(1) 农夫惯常早起。(2) 他惯常坐在桌旁的位置被一个陌生人占据了。(3) 实际上,这动作本身已经习惯成自然了。(4) 她的自尊心受到了伤害，但是她镇静自若的习惯帮助了她。
[sound:youdao-7a49c76c-dfda919d-591efae7-20c80504-1254690b.mp3]

translation:
n. 头发，毛发; （动、植物的）毛; 一丝丝，些微; 毛发织物

分布：头发(91%)，毛发(8%)，极少量(1%)


→来自ghers,挺直，硬毛，词源同horror,hirsute.引申词义毛发，头发。hair ’s breadth 毫厘之差
n.毛发,头发;绒毛,毛状物He had his hair cut.他理了发.



US [her] noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■the mass of thin thread-like structures on the head of a person, or any of these structures that grow out of the skin of a person or animal （人的）头发；（人或动物的）汗毛，毛发
•He's got short dark hair.他的头发短而黑。

•I'm going to have/get my hair cut.我要去理发。

•She brushed her long red hair.她梳理她那长长的红头发。

•He had lost his hair by the time he was twenty-five.他25岁时头发就掉光了。

•He's starting to get a few grey hairs now.他现在开始有白头发了。

•I found a hair in my soup.我在我的汤里面发现了一根头发。

UK [heər] US [her] noun countable or uncountable a hair's breadth ■a very small distance or amount 极短的距离，毫厘之差；细微的量
•His finger was within a hair's breadth of touching the alarm.他的手差一点点就碰到警报器了。

•She came within a hair's breadth of losing her life (= She nearly died).她差一点就丢了性命。

UK [heər] US [her] noun countable or uncountable get in sb's hair informal ■to annoy someone, usually by being present all the time （因不断打搅而）使（某人）厌烦
•My flatmate has been getting in my hair a bit recently.我的室友最近一直很烦人。

UK [heər] US [her] noun countable or uncountable the hair of the dog (that bit you) humorous ■an alcoholic drink taken as a cure the morning after an occasion when you have drunk too much alcohol 解宿醉的酒
UK [heər] US [her] noun countable or uncountable keep your hair on See keep your shirt on at shirt
UK [heər] US [her] noun countable or uncountable make sb's hair stand on end informal ■to make someone very frightened 令（某人）非常害怕，使（某人）毛骨悚然
•To be honest, the thought of jumping out of a moving aeroplane makes my hair stand on end.老实说，一想到从一架飞行中的飞机上跳下来就让我毛骨悚然。

UK [heər] US [her] noun countable or uncountable not a hair out of place ■If someone does not have a hair out of place, their appearance is very tidy 非常整洁
•She was immaculate as ever, not a hair out of place.她像往常一样干净整洁，从头到脚都没有丝毫凌乱。

UK [heər] US [her] noun countable or uncountable That'll put hairs on your chest! humorous ■something that is said to someone who is going to drink something that is very strongly alcoholic or eat something satisfying that will make their stomach feel full 那会使你像个男子汉！（当某人要喝烈酒或饱餐一顿时别人说的玩笑话）



n. 头发； [解剖] 毛发；些微
 - capello, poil
adj. [解剖] 毛发的；护理毛发的；用毛发制成的
 - pilar
examples: 英 [heə(r)] 美 [her]
n.头发；毛发；极少量
(1) I'll have my hair trimmed tomorrow.(2) She wears her hair in a bun.(3) Hair is easy to collect and convenient to store.(4) She won by a hair.
(1) 明天我要修剪头发。(2) 她把头发盘成一个髻。(3) 毛发既容搜集又便于保存。(4) 她以微弱的优势获胜。
[sound:youdao-88f8cf03-6a85e4cc-c003675f-f9457c1b-3e4c86f5.mp3]

translation:
n. 理发; 发型; 发式

分布：理发(84%)，发式(16%)


US ['her-] noun countable ■the style in which someone's hair is cut, or an occasion of cutting or styling the hair 发型，发式；理发
•I've had a really awful haircut.我的发型真难看。

•I wish he'd get/have a haircut.我希望他去理个发。




n. 理发；发型
 - frisure, hair style
examples: 英 ['heəkʌt] 美 ['herkʌt]
n.理发；发式
(1) Where do you go to get a haircut?(2) She teased him into getting a haircut.(3) He sprang a new haircut on his wife.
(1) 你去哪儿理发？(2) 她喋喋不休地哄他去理发。(3) 他为妻子创作了一个新的发式。
[sound:youdao-85a6b7a6-9b5888af-23a265f7-f1f530a4-58310f9d.mp3]

translation:
n. 过道，走廊; 大厅，前厅; 娱乐中心，会所

分布：大厅(89%)，礼堂(11%)


→来自古英语heall,屋顶覆盖的厅堂，住所，来自kel,隐藏，遮蔽，词源同cell,hole.引申词义前厅，门厅。
n.礼堂,会堂,办公大楼,门厅In the hall, the shallow challenger shall be allowed to swallow the swallows.在大厅里,肤浅的挑战者将被允许吞下燕子.



US [hɑ:l] noun countable BUILDING  建筑物   ESSENTIAL  ■a building or large room used for events involving a lot of people 礼堂，大厅，会堂
•the Royal Albert Hall皇家亚伯特厅

•a concert hall音乐厅

•the school sports hall学校体育馆

•I'm playing in a concert at the village/church hall.我将在村里的礼堂／教堂大厅所举行的音乐会参与演奏。

UK [hɔ:l] US [hɑ:l] noun countable ENTRANCE  入口   IMPROVER  (also hallway) ■the room just inside the main entrance of a house, apartment or other building which leads to other rooms and usually to the stairs 大厅；走廊
•I've left my bags in the hall.我把书包掉在大厅里了。




n. 门厅，走廊； [建] 会堂；食堂；学生宿舍
 - passage, corridor
examples: 英 [hɔːl] 美 [hɔːl]
n.大厅；礼堂

(1) The lecture is to be delivered at the hall.(2) There was a low murmur of conversation in the hall.(3) A multitude of people gathered at the gate of the exhibition hall.(4) There were plenty of people in front of the town's Hall.(5) Morning assemblage is held in the school hall.(6) The systematic arrangement of chairs makes the hall look spacious.
(1) 演讲将在大厅进行。(2) 大厅里有窃窃私语声。(3) 大群人聚集在展览大厅的门口。(4) 在城镇的大礼堂前有许多人。(5) 晨会在学校礼堂举行。(6) 座椅按照顺序排列，这使得礼堂里显得很宽敞。
[sound:youdao-e3b56e74-dd89ab9c-f1abd10b-302308ec-349db283.mp3]

translation:
n. 停止，中止; 暂停; 小火车站
vt. 使停止; 使中断; 阻止; 使立定
vi. 停止，立定; 犹豫

时态：halted, halting, halts
分布：停止(72%)，暂停(18%)，中止(3%)，跛行(2%)，止步(2%)，犹豫(2%)，踌躇(1%)


→来自古法语halte,停下，词源同hold.即使停止，停下。halt 跛行，踌躇
n.止步,停步,停止前进v.止步,(使)停止The tilted salt filters halt alternately for altering.倾斜的盐过滤器交替地停下以便改造.



US [hɑ:lt] verb intransitive or transitive  IMPROVER  ■to (cause to) stop moving or doing something or happening （使）停止，停下
•"Halt!" called the guard. "You can't go any further without a permit."“站住！”警卫喊道，“没有通行证不能入内。”

•Production has halted at all of the company's factories because of the pay dispute.由于工资纠纷，这家公司所有工厂都停产了。

•Security forces halted the demonstrators by blocking the road.警卫部队用封路的办法来制止示威者前进。

UK [hɒlt] US [hɑ:lt] noun only singular ■when something stops moving or happening 停止，停下，中止
•the recent halt in production最近的停产

•Severe flooding has brought  trains  to a halt (= prevented them from moving) on several lines in Scotland.凶猛的洪水使苏格兰几条铁路线上的火车停驶。

•The bus came to a halt (= stopped) just in time to avoid hitting the wall.公车正好及时停下，没有撞到墙上。

•If traffic increases beyond a certain level, the city grinds to a halt (= stops completely).如果交通流量的增长超过一定限度，城市就会陷于瘫痪状态。

•The car screeched to a halt (= suddenly and noisily stopped) just as the lights turned red.这辆车就在号志灯变红时嘎吱一声煞住了车。
call a halt to sth ■to prevent something from continuing 停止，中止
•How many more people will have to die before they call a halt to the fighting?还要死多少人他们才肯停战？





pause, stop, cease, halt, quit

这组词都有“停止”的意思，其区别是：
pause: 指暂时的、瞬间的停顿，隐含有再进行之意。
stop: 指动作、运行、进展等被停下来，含突然、断然的意味。
cease: 指逐渐、徐徐中止某种状态的存在。书面用词。
halt: 侧重突然地、决定性地终止、停止某一活动。
quit: 指最终彻底停止某事，有时暗示遭到失败或面临挫折。


vi. 停止；立定；踌躇，犹豫
 - desist from, come to a stop
n. 停止；立定；休息
 - break, stop, rest, stay, stand
vt. 使停止；使立定
 - put a stop to
examples: 英 [hɔːlt] 美 [hɔːlt]
n.停止；止步v.停止；中止；暂停v.踌躇；犹豫；跛行

(1) He tried to bring that debate to a halt.(2) The officer called a halt to attacks.(3) The thought brought her to an abrupt halt.(4) No one can halt the advance of history.(5) A government official confirmed Mr Hu had ordered a halt after reading the letters.(6) This halt in the rise of real wages has not been a consequence inherent in the nature of unions.(7) The soldiers halted for a rest.
(1) 他试图使这场辩论停止。(2) 那个军官下令停止进攻。(3) 她一想到这个便猛地停下了。(4) 谁也阻挡不了历史的前进。(5) 有关官方也确认胡在读信后发出了中止令。(6) 实际工资收入中止增长，这并不是工会本身性质所决定的一个内在必然的结果。(7) 士兵们停下来休息。
[sound:youdao-be075ee7-b8f4ecf4-82bcefa0-f2e9ac32-9f7375c7.mp3]

translation:
n. 铁锤，榔头; 链球; （拍卖时用的）木槌; 音槌
vt. & vi. 锤打; 反复敲打，连续击打（尤指发出大声）
vt. 击败; 猛踢; 猛击; 轻易打败（对方）

时态：hammered, hammering, hammers
分布：锤(82%)，榔头(7%)，锤击(4%)，锤打(4%)，反复敲打(2%)，严厉批评(1%)


→来自中古英语hamer,锤子，来自ekmo,石头，来自ak,尖的，锋利的，词源同acid,cone,cuneiform.拼写比较humor.
n.铁锤,槌,榔头v.锤击,敲打The sum of the hammers is made in the summer summary.锤子总额在夏季总结里作了统计.



US [-ɚ] noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a tool consisting of a piece of metal with a flat end which is fixed onto the end of a long thin usually wooden handle, used for hitting things 锤，铁锤
UK ['hæm.ər] US [-ɚ] noun countable be/go at it hammer and tongs informal ■to do something, especially to argue, with a lot of energy or violence 激烈地做某事（尤指争论）
UK ['hæm.ər] US [-ɚ] noun countable come/go under the hammer ■to be sold at an auction (= public sale where objects are bought by the people who offer the most money) 被拍卖
•A private collection of her early paintings is expected to go under the hammer next year.一批由私人收藏的她的早期画作预计将于明年拍卖。

UK ['hæm.ər] US [-ɚ] verb TOOL  工具  intransitive or transitive [usually + adv/prep] ■to hit something with a hammer （用锤子）敲击
•Can you hold this nail in position while I hammer it into the door?你能托住这颗钉子，好让我把它钉进门里吗？

•I could hear you hammering upstairs.我能听见你在楼上敲打的声音。

•My car's got a dent, and I was hoping they'd be able to hammer it out (= remove it by hammering).我的车上有一处凹痕，我希望他们能把它敲平。

UK ['hæm.ər] US [-ɚ] verb FORCE  力量  intransitive or transitive [usually + adv/prep] ■to hit or kick something with a lot of force 用力敲打；猛踢
•I was woken up suddenly by the sound of someone hammering on/at the front door.有人重重地捶打前门，把我惊醒了。

•He hammered the ball into the net, giving France a 3-2 win over Italy.他将球劲射入网，使法国队以3比2战胜了义大利队。

UK ['hæm.ər] US [-ɚ] verb DEFEAT  击败  transitive informal ■to defeat someone completely in a game or a fight （在比赛或战斗中）彻底击败，击垮
•We were hammered in both games.我们两场比赛都被击败了。

UK ['hæm.ər] US [-ɚ] verb CRITICIZE  批评  transitive informal ■to criticize someone or something strongly 严厉批评，指责
•Her latest film has been hammered by the critics.她最新拍摄的电影遭到评论家们的猛烈批评。

UK ['hæm.ər] US [-ɚ] verb hammer home sth ■to make certain that something is understood by expressing it clearly and forcefully 解释清楚，阐明
•The advertising campaign will try to hammer home the message that excessive drinking is a health risk.这次广告宣传将使大家清楚地了解饮酒过量有害健康。

UK ['hæm.ər] US [-ɚ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   hammer away at sth informal ■to work without stopping and with a lot of effort 坚持不懈地努力做
UK ['hæm.ər] US [-ɚ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   hammer sth into sb (also hammer sth in) ■to force someone to understand something by repeating it a lot 反覆向（某人）灌输
•I always had it hammered into me that I mustn't lie.我总是反覆嘱咐自己不能撒谎。

UK ['hæm.ər] US [-ɚ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] hammer sth out ■to reach an agreement or solution after a lot of argument or discussion （争论或讨论后）达成（协定或解决办法）
•Three years after the accident the lawyers finally managed to hammer out a settlement with the insurance company.事故发生三年后，律师们终于与保险公司商定了解决办法。




vi. 锤击；敲打；重复
 - read back
n. 铁锤；链球； [解剖] 锤骨；音锤
 - tupid, malleus
examples: 英 ['hæmə(r)] 美 ['hæmər]
n.锤；榔头vi.锤击；反复敲打vt.锤打；严厉批评

(1) He hit the nail into the wall with a hammer.(2) He smashed a hole in the window with a hammer.(3) He took a hammer and recessed a hole into the wall.(4) The teacher has been trying to hammer in the facts.(5) The police hammered the door.(6) Her latest movie was hammered by the critics.
(1) 他用一把锤子把钉子打进墙里去。(2) 他用锤子在玻璃上打了个洞。(3) 他拿起一个榔头，在墙上敲出一个洞。(4) 教师一直设法把这些事实灌输给学生。(5) 警察不停地敲门。(6) 她最近的一部电影遭到评论家的批评。
[sound:youdao-81614b51-6c5342f6-bcb79ac6-c7f33335-0bdf3d4b.mp3]

translation:
n. 手帕; 方巾，围巾

分布：手帕(96%)，围巾(3%)，方巾(1%)


→hand,手，kerchief,头巾，围巾。引申词义手帕。
n.手帕The handy left-hander left a handsome handkerchief on the handle of the handbag.手巧的左撇子把一方漂亮手帕留在手提包的提手上.



US [-kɚ-] noun countable (plural handkerchiefs or UK ALSO  handkerchieves) (informal hankie, hanky) ■a square piece of cloth used for cleaning the nose or drying the eyes when they are wet with tears 手帕
•She took out her handkerchief and blew her nose loudly.她掏出手帕大声地擤鼻涕。
 Compare tissue



n. 手帕；头巾，围巾
 - hanky, noserag
examples: 英 ['hæŋkətʃɪf] 美 ['hæŋkərtʃɪf]
n.手帕；方巾；围巾

(1) She was playing with her handkerchief all the while during the speech.(2) I polished my buttons with a handkerchief.(3) She embroidered her initials on the handkerchief.(4) I folded the handkerchief and put it in my pocket.(5) She fluttered her handkerchief from the train window as a good-bye.
(1) 她在演讲时一直都在玩弄手帕。(2) 我用手帕把钮扣擦亮。(3) 她把她姓名的起首字母绣在手帕上。(4) 我折好手绢，放进口袋里。(5) 她从火车窗口里伸出手挥动手帕道别。

translation:
n. （织物、毛皮等的）手感; 手柄; 举动; 柄状物
vi. 操作，操控; 容易搬运
vt. 用双手触摸、举起或握住; 用手操作，操纵; 处理或负责，管理; 〈美〉买卖，经营

时态：handled, handling, handles
分布：处理(46%)，柄(31%)，把手(15%)，操作(5%)，触(1%)，对待(1%)，买卖(1%)


→来自hand,手，-le,工具格后缀。引申词义操纵，比较manipulate.
n.柄,把手,拉手v.处理,对待,操纵;触,抚养The handy left-hander left a handsome handkerchief on the handle of the handbag.手巧的左撇子把一方漂亮手帕留在手提包的提手上.
【记】hand（手），le一把手【反】cumbersome（adj 讨厌的；麻烦的；笨重的）－easy to handle（容易处理的）



noun countable PART  部分   ADVANCED  ■a part of an object designed for holding, moving or carrying the object easily 柄，把手
•a door handle门把手

•the handle on a suitcase手提箱的提手

•I can't pick the kettle up - the handle's too hot.我没法拿起茶壶，壶柄太烫了。

•She turned the handle and slowly opened the door.她转动把手，慢慢地打开门。

['hæn.dl] noun countable NAME  名称  informal ■a name of a person or place, especially a strange one （尤指奇怪的）名字，名称
•That's some handle to go through life with!一辈子取那样一个名字也够奇怪的！

['hæn.dl] verb DEAL WITH  处理   ESSENTIAL  transitive ■to deal with, have responsibility for, or be in charge of 处理；应付；负责
•I thought he handled the situation very well.我认为他把局面处理得非常好。

•Some people are brilliant with computers, but have no idea how to handle (= behave with) other people.有些人在电脑方面很出色，却不会与人打交道。

•If you can't handle the job I'll get someone else to do it.如果你做不了这项工作，我会让别人来做。

•Who handles the marketing in your company?你们公司谁负责市场行销？

['hæn.dl] verb TOUCH  触碰  transitive ■to pick something up and touch, hold or move it with your hands （用手）触摸，拿，搬动
•Always wash your hands before handling food.拿食物之前一定要洗手。

•Please don't handle the vases - they're very fragile.请不要触碰花瓶，它们极易破碎。

['hæn.dl] verb OPERATE  操作  transitive ■to operate or control something which could be difficult or dangerous 操作，控制（困难或危险的事物）
•Have you ever handled a gun before?你以前用过枪吗？
intransitive usually + adverb or preposition ■If a car handles well, it is easy and pleasant to drive. （汽车）驾驶起来
['hæn.dl] verb SELL  出售  transitive ■to buy and sell goods 买卖（商品）
•We only handle cosmetics which have not been tested on animals.我们只经营未在动物身上做过试验的化妆品。

•mainly UK He's been arrested for handling stolen goods.他因卖赃物被捕。





deal with, cope with, dispose of, manage, handle

这些动词或短语动词都含有“处理”，“对付”之意。
deal with: 既可指处理具体事情，也可指处理或解决具有抽象意义的问题。
cope with: 指成功地处理或对付更为重大，更为严重的问题或事物。
dispose of: 与deal with同义，普通用法。
manage: 指处理日常事务与工作，也可指经营管理。
handle: 从原义“手柄”，转引申为作“处理”解时，其内涵是管理和操纵。


n. [建] 把手；柄；手感；口实
 - shank, grip
vt. 处理；操作；运用；买卖；触摸
 - operate, feel, exert, work, cope with
examples: 英 ['hændl] 美 ['hændl]
v.处理；对待；操作；触；买卖n.把手；柄

(1) I was impressed by her handling of the affair.(2) The speaker was roughly handled by the mob.(3) He's not a very good teacher---he doesn't know how to handle children.(4) He knows how to handle the machine.(5) Customers are asked not to handle the goods in the shop.(6) We don't handle that sort of book.(7) I turned the handle and opened the door.(8) The handle of the hammer came away easily.(9) She burnt herself on a red-hot pan handle.
(1) 我觉得她对此事的处理很了不起。(2) 演说者受到暴民的粗暴对待。(3) 他不是一个好的老师---他不懂得如何对待孩子。(4) 他会操作这台机器。(5) 请顾客不要触摸商店里的货物。(6) 我们不经销那一类书。(7) 我转了转拉手,把门打开。(8) 这锤柄很容易脱落。(9) 她被炽热的锅柄烫伤了。
[sound:youdao-e41ba235-23f96493-c57913b1-145b267d-de2e0d0c.mp3]

translation:
adj. 英俊的，健美的; 美观的; 大方的; 数量大的

级别：handsomer, handsomest
分布：英俊的(81%)，可观的(17%)，灵巧的(1%)，慷慨大方的(1%)


→来自hand的引申义，即手边的，方便的，-some,形容词后缀。后来引申灵巧的，体贴的，大方的，慷慨的等多种词义，但主要用于形容男子潇洒的，英俊的，实质上即暖男。
a.漂亮的,英俊的;慷慨的,数量可观的The handy left-hander left a handsome handkerchief on the handle of the handbag.手巧的左撇子把一方漂亮手帕留在手提包的提手上.



adjective ATTRACTIVE  吸引人的   ADVANCED  ■describes a man who is physically attractive in a traditional, male way （男子）英俊的，漂亮的
•She's dreaming she'll be whisked off her feet by a tall, dark handsome stranger.她梦想自己被一位高大黝黑的英俊陌生男子迷得神魂颠倒。
■describes a woman who is attractive but in a strong way （女子）健美的
•a handsome woman in her fifties一位五十多岁的健美女子

['hæn.səm] adjective LARGE AMOUNT  大量  [before noun] ■large in amount 大量的，数量可观的
•They made a handsome profit on their house.他们利用自己的房子赚了一大笔钱。





beautiful, lovely, handsome, fine, pretty, fair

这组词都有“美丽的，漂亮的”的意思，其区别是：
beautiful: 普通用词，含义广泛，语气最强，指优美和谐，是一种几乎接近完美的美。指人时通常形容女人或小孩，很少用于描写男子。
lovely: 普通用词，描写人时，主要指女人和小孩的相貌，语气不如beautiful强。
handsome: 多用于描写男性的英俊潇洒。有时也形容女人，指其五官端正，体态秀丽。
fine: 指在容貌、身材或风度等方面令人感到可爱。用于事物时，强调形式或内容的优美。
pretty: 普通用词，语气比beautiful弱，多用于描写妇女、儿童以及小巧玲珑，精美可爱之物。
fair: 正式用词，多用于文学中，形容女子和儿童，侧重外表的美。



beautiful, handsome, pretty, good-looking

beautiful: 貌美动人，气质高雅；
handsome: 体态健美端庄；
pretty: 活泼可爱；
good-looking: 一般性“好看”


adj. （男子）英俊的；可观的；大方的，慷慨的；健美而端庄的
 - generous, liberal
examples: 英 ['hænsəm] 美 ['hænsəm]
adj.可观的；英俊的；慷慨大方的；灵巧的

(1) The waitress received a handsome tip.(2) He is a reporter on the news,and draws a handsome screw.(3) Her bridegroom is a handsome young man.(4) Her husband is a very handsome young man.(5) She was thrilled when the handsome filmstar kissed her.(6) It's handsome of him to give me a present.(7) I got a handsome present on my birthday.(8) The little girl is pretty handsome.
(1) 女侍者收到了数量可观的小费。(2) 他是新闻记者，领取可观的薪水。(3) 她的新郎是一个英俊的年轻人。(4) 她丈夫是一个非常英俊的年轻人。(5) 当那位英俊的电影明星吻她的时候，她欣喜若狂。(6) 他慷慨大方地给了我一份送礼物。(7) 在我生日那天我收到一份出手大方的礼物。(8) 这个小女孩长得很灵巧。
[sound:youdao-d6feef3a-9d2bcb7e-2e2e9e1f-f3cb8c6a-0f88f694.mp3]

translation:
n. 书法，手书; 笔迹，字迹
v. 亲手写(handwrite的ing形式)

分布：笔迹(66%)，书法(34%)


→hand,手，writing,书写。
n.笔迹,手迹,书法Your handwriting is very good.你的书法很好.



US [-tˌɪŋ] noun uncountable  ADVANCED  ■writing with a pen or pencil 书写
•We need to ensure that handwriting is properly taught in our primary schools.我们要确保小学里有正规的习字课。
 ADVANCED  ■the particular way in which someone forms letters with a pen or pencil 字迹，笔迹
•His handwriting is illegible.他的笔迹很难认。




n. [法] 笔迹；书法；书写；手稿
 - writing, calligraphy
examples: 英 ['hændraɪtɪŋ] 美 ['hændraɪtɪŋ]
n.笔迹；书法

(1) The handwriting on both cheques is identical.(2) It's always a problem deciphering his handwriting.(3) My handwriting cannot compete with his.(4) There is need for improvement in your handwriting.
(1) 两张支票上的笔迹完全相同。(2) 辨认他的笔迹有困难。(3) 我的书法不及他。(4) 你的书法需要改进。
[sound:youdao-984e7dfb-e73191d9-db9b74aa-01f4a406-00b9e7ff.mp3]

translation:
adj. 方便的; 手边的，附近的; 便于使用的; 手巧的

级别：handier, handiest
分布：方便的(68%)，手边的(15%)，近便的(8%)，现成的(6%)，灵巧的(3%)


→来自hand,手。即手边的，近手的，引申义方便的，便利的。
a.手边的,近便的;方便的The handy left-hander left a handsome handkerchief on the handle of the handbag.手巧的左撇子把一方漂亮手帕留在手提包的提手上.



adjective USEFUL  有用的  ■useful or convenient 有用的；方便的；便利的
•a handy container/tool实用的容器／工具

•First-time visitors to France will find this guide particularly handy.初次来法国的游览者会发现这本旅游指南很有用。

•It's a nice house and it's handy for (= near) the station.这座房子很漂亮，离车站也很近。

•informal Don't throw those bottles away - they'll come in handy (= be useful) for the picnic next Sunday.别把那些瓶子扔掉——下周日出去野餐会派上用场。

['hæn.di] adjective SKILFUL  有技巧的  [after verb] ■able to use something skilfully 手巧的
•Jonathan's good at wallpapering but he's not so handy with a paintbrush.乔纳森贴壁纸很在行，但拿起油漆刷来就不那么得心应手了。

•Susannah's very handy (= good at doing things which need skilled use of the hands) about the house.苏珊娜非常善于打理房子。




adj. 便利的；手边的，就近的； [水运] 容易取得的；敏捷的
 - sharp, quick, smart, keen, fly
examples: 英 ['hændi] 美 ['hændi]
adj.方便的；手边的；灵巧的；近便的；现成的

(1) An electric kettle is very handy.(2) The sailors clung to anything handy.(3) He is very handy at repairing clocks.(4) It is quite a handy little sailing boat.(5) Our flat is very handy for the schools.(6) The house is very handy for the shops.(7) When ideas fail, words come in very handy.
(1) 电水壶使用非常方便。(2) 水手们紧紧抓住手边任何东西。(3) 他修钟表很灵巧。(4) 这是一个相当灵巧的小帆船。(5) 我们的住所离学校很近，非常方便。(6) 这房子离商店很近便。(7) 想法失败的时候，词语就在手边。
[sound:youdao-47a2156f-a70e0e7b-5fb0812d-6b22f539-f2bc63c8.mp3]

translation:
vt. 悬挂; （被）绞死; 贴，装饰; 使悬而未决
vi. 悬垂; 被吊死; 附属，依靠; 悬而未决
n. 悬挂的样子; （动作的）暂停; 〈口〉大意，要点; 〈口〉做法，诀窍

时态：hung, hanging, hangs
分布：悬挂(55%)，绞死(26%)，逗留(13%)，绞刑(4%)，悬挂方式(2%)


→来自konk,悬挂，词源同hinge.引申词义绞刑，绞死。
v.悬挂,垂吊;吊死,绞死The language angel hanged up the gang and banged them at the angle of the triangle.语文天使将那伙人吊起朝三角形的角上猛撞.



verb FIX AT TOP  固定在顶部   ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive [+ adv/prep] (hung, hung)■to fasten or support something at the top leaving the other parts free to move, or to be held in this way 悬挂，吊；吊着
•A heavy gold necklace hung around her neck.她脖子上挂着一串粗重的金项炼。

•Long creepers hung (down) from the trees.长藤从树上垂下来。

•The curtains hung in thick folds.窗帘打着密密的摺子垂着。

•Hang your coat and hat (up) on the rack over there.把你的大衣和帽子挂在那边的架子上。

•Many of his finest pictures hang/are hung (= are fixed to the wall so that they can be seen) in the National Gallery.他有许多上乘画作在国家美术馆中展出。

•Hang the pheasant/Let the pheasant hang for a few days for the flavour to improve before you cook it.在烹调雉鸡肉之前先把它挂起来晾几天，这样味道会更好。
transitive (hung, hung)■If you hang wallpaper, you fix it to the wall. 贴（壁纸）
[hæŋ] verb KILL  杀死   ADVANCED  intransitive or transitive (hanged or hung, hanged or hung)■to kill someone, especially as punishment for a serious crime, by dropping them with a rope tied around their neck, or to die in this way 绞死；施以绞刑；被绞死
•He was found guilty and hanged later that year.他被判有罪，并在那年的晚些时候被施以绞刑。

•With so little evidence to prove her guilt, few people thought she should hang.没有甚么确凿的证据证明她有罪，所以很少有人认为她会被绞死。

•[R] The woman tried to hang her self with a sheet.那个女人试图用一条床单上吊。
⇒ See also hangman
[hæŋ] verb STAY  停留  intransitive (hung, hung)■to stay in the air 停留，悬浮（在空气中）
•The falcon seemed to hang in the air for a moment before diving onto its prey.猎鹰似乎在空中停了一下才扑向猎物。

•Smoke from the houses hung above the village.炊烟袅袅，弥漫在村庄上空。

•literary The sound of the bells hung in the midnight air.午夜的钟声回荡在夜空中。

[hæŋ] verb BEND DOWN  弯下  intransitive or transitive (hung, hung)■to curve down 弯下，垂下
•The branches hung heavy with snow.树枝被雪压弯了。

•He knew he'd done something wrong and hung his head in shame.他知道自己做错了事，于是羞愧地低下了头。

[hæŋ] verb go hang (yourself) informal ■You say that someone can go hang (themselves) if you do not care what they say or do about something 见鬼去吧
•If she's expecting the report by tomorrow she can go hang herself.如果她指望明天之前报告能出来的话，那就随便她去吧。

[hæŋ] verb hang by a thread ■If a serious situation hangs by a thread, it means that even a slight change can decide what will happen and that a bad result such as death, failure, etc. is likely 千钧一发；岌岌可危；危在旦夕
•The mayor's political future has been hanging by a thread since the fraud scandal.诈欺丑闻爆发后，市长的政治前途岌岌可危。

[hæŋ] verb hang on in there (also hang in there) ■said as a way of telling someone to not give up, despite difficulties 坚持住；挺住
•Work can get tough in the middle of a term but hang on in there and it'll be OK.到了学期中功课会变得很难，但坚持下去就会顺利的。

[hæŋ] verb hang the cost/expense ■the cost is not important 别管多少钱
•Just buy it and hang the expense!买吧，别管它多少钱！

[hæŋ] verb hang tough US informal ■to not change your actions or opinions although other people try to make you do this 立场坚定，毫不妥协
•The President is hanging tough on the hostage crisis.总统在处理人质危机时毫不妥协。

[hæŋ] verb have sb/sth hanging round your neck informal disapproving ■to be limited in what you can do by someone or something 受…的拖累
•The last thing I want is a couple of kids hanging round my neck!我最不希望的就是有几个孩子拖累着我！

[hæŋ] verb hung, drawn and quartered ■In the past, if someone was hung, drawn and quartered, they were hanged by the neck and their body was cut into pieces. 处以绞刑后碎尸
[hæŋ] verb I'll be hanged if... UK old-fashioned ■used to express your determination not to do something or not to allow someone else to do something 我绝不会…；让…见鬼去吧
•I'll be hanged if I'm going to clean up after him!我才不会跟在他后面整理他弄乱的东西呢！

[hæŋ] verb I'll be hanged if I know (also I'm hanged if I know) UK old-fashioned informal ■used to say that you certainly do not know 如果我知道我就不得好死
[hæŋ] verb You might as well be hung for a sheep as for a lamb. UK saying ■said to mean that because the punishment for a bad action and an even worse one will be the same, you have no reason not to do the worse one 既然惩罚都一样，我还不如索性做得更差些。
[hæŋ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   hang around (UK also hang about) informal ■to move or do things slowly 缓慢地移动；缓慢地做
•Go and pack but don't hang around - we have to go in an hour.赶快去收拾行李，别慢吞吞的——一小时后我们必须出发。

[hæŋ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   hang around (somewhere) (UK also hang about) ■to wait or spend time somewhere, usually for no particular reason 闲逛，闲荡
•I spent most of my youth hanging around the bars of Dublin.我年轻时多半时间都泡在都柏林的酒吧里。

•I thought I'd hang around for a while and see if she comes.我想在这里闲逛一会儿，看看她是否会来。

[hæŋ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   hang around with sb (UK also hang about with sb) ■to spend time with someone 与（某人）厮混
•I got into drugs because I was hanging around with the wrong people.我染上了毒瘾，这是因为我与不好的家伙混在一起。

[hæŋ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   hang back ■to be slow to do something, often because of fear or having no confidence （因害怕或缺乏信心而）犹豫，踌躇不前
•There's no need to hang back - you can sing as well as anyone.没甚么好犹豫的——你会和其他人唱得一样好。

[hæŋ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   hang on WAIT   ADVANCED  informal ■to wait for a short time 稍等一会儿
•Sally's on the other phone - would you like to hang on?莎莉正在接另一个电话，你能等一会儿吗？

•Do you need the toilet right now or can you hang on for a while?你现在就要上厕所还是能再等一会儿呢？

•Hang on a minute - I'll be with you in a moment!等一下——我马上就来！
HOLD   ADVANCED  ■to hold or continue holding onto something 紧握，抓住
•Hang on tight - it's going to be a very bumpy ride.抓紧点——接下来的路会很颠簸。
⇒ See also hanger-on
[hæŋ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   hang sth on sb informal ■to blame someone for something, especially something they did not do 把（尤指某人没做过的事）怪罪在（某人）头上
•I wasn't anywhere near the house when the window was broken, so you can't hang that on me!窗户玻璃被打破的时候我根本就不在房子附近，所以你不能把这个怪到我头上！

[hæŋ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   hang on/upon sth GIVE ATTENTION  ■to give careful attention to something, especially something that someone says 密切关注，（尤指）注意听（某人说的话）
•He hangs on her every word as if she were some sort of goddess.他全神贯注地听她讲每一句话，就好像她是位女神似的。
DEPEND ON  ■to depend on something 依靠，依赖
•The safety of air travel hangs partly on the thoroughness of baggage checking.乘飞机旅行的安全性在一定程度上仰赖对行李彻底的检查。

[hæŋ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   hang onto sth  ADVANCED  ■to keep something 保留，保存
•You should hang onto that painting - it might be valuable.你应该保留那幅画，它可能会很值钱。

[hæŋ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   hang out informal  ADVANCED  ■to spend a lot of time in a place or with someone 经常出入（某场所）；（与某人）厮混
•You still hang out at the pool hall?你仍然经常出没于桌球场吗？

•I've been hanging out backstage with the band.我常在后台与乐队混在一起。

[hæŋ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   hang over sth ■If a threat or doubt hangs over a place or a situation, it exists （威胁或疑虑）笼罩，萦绕
•Uncertainty again hangs over the project.这个计划又再次变得不确定起来。

[hæŋ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   hang together STAY TOGETHER  ■If people hang together, they help each other and work together to achieve something 团结一致，同心协力
•If the opposition party can hang together over the next six months, they might just stand a chance of being elected.如果反对党在今后的六个月里能团结一致，他们可能有机会在选举中获胜。
SEEM TRUE  ■If the parts of something hang together, they are well organized or they seem to be true or correct 连贯，合逻辑；看似符合事实
•Somehow her story doesn't quite hang together.不知为甚么，她的故事听起来不像是真的。

[hæŋ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   hang up ■to end a telephone conversation 挂断电话
hang 1	1. He started shouting so I hung up (on him). 他开始大喊大叫，我就挂断了电话。
•Let me speak to Melanie before you hang up.在你挂电话之前让我和梅拉妮说几句话。

[hæŋ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] hang sth up ■to stop using and needing something because you have given up the sport or activity it is used for 不再使用；收起
•So when did you hang up your boxing gloves/golfclubs/ballet shoes?你甚么时候不再参加拳击比赛／打高尔夫球／跳芭蕾了呢？

[hæŋ] noun get the hang of sth  ADVANCED  informal ■to learn how to do something, especially if it is not obvious or simple 学会做（尤指不那么简单明了的事）
•"I've never used a word processor before." "Don't worry - you'll soon get the hang of it."“我以前从未使用过文字处理器。”“别担心──你很快就会用了。”
the hang ■the way something made of cloth looks when it is hanging （布料制成的东西的）悬挂状
•That coat fits you so well - the hang is perfect.你穿这件外套太合适了——非常有型。





suspend, hang

这组词都有“挂，吊”的意思，其区别是：
suspend: 侧重悬挂物支撑点的灵活性和活动自由。
hang: 通常指一端固定于一点或一条线上，另一端悬于空中的状态。


vt. 悬挂，垂下；装饰；绞死；使悬而未决
 - paint, swing from
vi. 悬着，垂下；被绞死；悬而不决
 - trail
n. 悬挂；暂停，中止
 - moratorium, pause
examples: 英 [hæŋ] 美 [hæŋ]
v.悬挂；(使)低垂；悬浮(在空中)；逗留；绞死n.悬挂方式；悬挂；绞刑

(1) You may hang your coat on the hook.(2) I'll hang the pictures as high as I can.(3) All the shirts hang together in the same wardrobe.(4) Cigarette smoke hung in the air.(5) The notion hung in his mind for days.(6) He was hanged for murder.(7) The hang of the curtain shows that somebody is standing behind it.(8) She was condemned to hang for killing her husband.
(1) 你可以把外套挂在钩子上。(2) 我将尽可能把这些画挂得高。(3) 所有的衬衫都挂在同一个衣橱里。(4) 香烟烟雾在空气中缭绕。(5) 几天来他老是在转这个念头。(6) 他因犯谋杀罪而被处以绞刑。(7) 窗帘悬挂的样子表明有人站在后面。(8) 她因杀害亲夫被处以绞刑。

translation:
vi. 发生; 碰巧; 出现; 偶然遇到

时态：happened, happening, happens
分布：发生(83%)，出现(9%)，碰巧(7%)，偶遇(1%)


→hap,发生，运气，机会，词源同happy.即好运发生，后用于中性词即可指发生的好运也可指坏运。
发生(hap+pen表动词→机会来了→发生)[hap=chance,表示"机会,运气"]
v.(偶然)发生;碰巧,恰好No extraordinary disorder happens on the orderly border.在有序的边界上没有发生不寻常的混乱.



verb intransitive HAVE EXISTENCE  存在   ESSENTIAL  ■(of a situation or an event) to have existence or come into existence 发生
•No one knows exactly what happened but several people have been hurt.没人确实了解发生了甚么事，只知道有数人受伤。

•Anything could happen in the next half hour.接下来的半小时内甚么事都可能会发生。

•A funny thing happened in the office today.今天，办公室里发生了一件有趣的事。

•I don't like to think what might have happened if he'd been driving any faster.我不愿意去想假如他再开快一点的话会怎么样。
happen to sb  ESSENTIAL  ■If something happens to someone or something, it has an effect on them and changes them in some way 发生在（某人）身上；作用于…
•I don't know what I'd do if anything happened to him (= if he was hurt, became ill, or died).我不知道一旦他出了事我该怎么办。

•What happened to your jacket? There's a big rip in the sleeve.你的夹克怎么了？袖子上裂了一条大痕。

•What's happened to my pen (= Where is it) ? I put it down there a few moments ago.我的钢笔哪里去了？我刚刚把它放在那里。

['hæp.ən] verb intransitive CHANCE  偶然   IMPROVER  ■to do or be by chance 偶然，碰巧
•[+ to infinitive] They happened to look (= looked by chance) in the right place almost immediately.他们碰巧几乎一下就找对了地方。

•[+ (that)] Fortunately it happened (that) there was no one in the house at the time of the explosion.幸运的是，爆炸发生时，屋子里没有人。

•[+ that] It just so happens that I have her phone number right here.非常凑巧，我正好有她的电话号码。

•She happens to like cleaning (= She likes cleaning, although that is surprising).她刚好就喜欢打扫清洁。

•I happen to think he's right (= I do think so, although you do not).我真的认为他是对的。

•As it happened (= Although it was not planned) , I had a few minutes to spare.我碰巧有几分钟空闲。

['hæp.ən] verb intransitive   Phrasal Verbs   happen along/by (somewhere) mainly US ■to go to a place by chance or without planning to 碰巧来到
•I'd have drowned if he hadn't happened along and pulled me out of the river.要不是他碰巧走过，把我从河里拉上来，我可能已经溺死了。

['hæp.ən] verb intransitive   Phrasal Verbs   happen on/upon sth/sb literary ■to find or meet something or someone by chance 偶然发现；偶然遇到
•Eventually they happened on a road leading across the desert.最后，他们偶然找到了一条穿越沙漠的路。

['hæp.ən] verb intransitive   Common Learner Errors   happenWarning:  Check your verb endings!Many learners make mistakes when using happen  in the past tense.In the past simple and past participle, don't write 'happenned' or 'happended', write happened.The -ing form is happening.
['hæp.ən] adverb Northern english ■possibly; I expect that 可能；我估计
•Happen it'll rain later on.过一会儿可能会下雨。





take place, chance, happen, occur

这组词都有“发生”的意思，其区别是：
take place: 多指通过人为安排的发生。
chance: 侧重事前无安排或无准备而发生的事，特指巧合。
happen: 普通用词，泛指一切客观事物或情况的发生，强调动作的偶然性。
occur: 较正式用词，可指意外地发生，也可指意料中的发生。


vi. 发生；碰巧；偶然遇到
 - occur, proceed, chance
examples: 英 ['hæpən] 美 ['hæpən]
vi.发生；碰巧；出现；偶遇

(1) The accident happened at six o'clock.(2) It is impossible to anticipate when it will happen.(3) I happened to see her yesterday.(4) I happen to have the official statistics with me.(5) I tremble at the thought of what may happen.(6) I happened on just the thing I'd been looking for.
(1) 事故发生在六点钟。(2) 不可能预料这事何时发生。(3) 我昨天碰巧见到她。(4) 我碰巧身边有官方的统计数字。(5) 我想到可能出现的情况就不寒而栗。(6) 我偶然发现了我一直在寻找的东西。
[sound:youdao-d3ff0b3b-b5c715a0-87fc2ef2-5a537c0a-6cd7ce04.mp3]

translation:
adj. 幸福的; 快乐的; 巧妙的; 〈口〉有点醉意的

级别：happier, happiest
分布：幸福的(59%)，高兴的(26%)，幸运的(11%)，乐意的(4%)


→来自hap,发生，运气，机会。即运气好的，引申词义高兴的。
幸运的;幸福的(hap+py→有运气的→幸福的)[hap=chance,表示"机会,运气"]
a.快乐的,幸福的;乐意的;令人满意的Perhaps something happy will happen to the unhappy man.或许那个不高兴的人将要碰上某件快乐的事.



adjective PLEASED  高兴的   ESSENTIAL  ■feeling, showing or causing pleasure or satisfaction 幸福的；满意的；快乐的
•a happy marriage/childhood幸福的婚姻／童年

•She looks so happy.她看起来非常快乐。

•School days are said to be the happiest days of your life.学生时代据说是一生中最快乐的时光。

•Nicky seems a lot happier since she met Steve.尼基自从认识史蒂夫之后似乎快乐多了。

•You'll be happy to know that Jean is coming with us.要是知道尚和我们一起前来，你会很高兴的。

•I'm perfectly happy to (= I will willingly) help out.我非常愿意帮忙。

•I'm so happy (that) everything is working out for you.我很高兴你一切都很顺利。

•Barry seems happy enough working for himself.巴里似乎很乐意为自己工作。

•Are you happy about/with (= satisfied with) your new working arrangements?你对新的工作安排满意吗？

•Your mother's not going to be very happy when she sees the mess you've made!你妈妈如果看到你弄得乱七八糟，她是不会高兴的。

•formal The manager will be happy (= is willing) to see you this afternoon.经理很乐意今天下午见你。

['hæp.i] adjective GREETING  问候   IMPROVER  [before noun] ■(used in greetings for special occasions) full of enjoyment and pleasure （用于特殊日子的祝福）快乐的，幸福的
•Happy Birthday!生日快乐！

•Happy Anniversary!周年快乐！

•Happy New Year!新年快乐！

['hæp.i] adjective LUCKY  幸运的  [before noun] ■(of a condition or situation) lucky （情况）幸运的
•We hadn't planned to be in France at the same time as Ann and Charles - it was just a happy coincidence.我们从未打算与安和查尔斯同时到法国——那只是一个幸运的巧合。

['hæp.i] adjective SUITABLE  合适的  literary■(of words or behaviour) suitable （言语或行为）恰当的，得体的
•It wasn't a happy choice of phrase given the circumstances.这样的措词不适合这种场合。

['hæp.i] adjective the happy day humorous ■a marriage 婚礼
•So when's the happy day then?那么婚礼何时举行？

['hæp.i] adjective the happy event (US also the blessed event) humorous ■the birth of a child 喜事（指孩子出生）
['hæp.i] adjective not be a happy bunny UK humorous ■to be annoyed about a situation 烦恼的，愠怒的
•Her computer crashed an hour ago and she's lost a morning's work - she's not a happy bunny at the moment.她的电脑一小时前发生故障，害得她一早上的工作成果都没了。她现在还为此闷闷不乐呢。





joyful, glad, delightful, merry, gay, happy, agreeable, jolly, nice, pleasant, cheerful

这组词都有“愉快的，高兴的”的意思，其区别是：
joyful: 语气较强，强调心情或感情上的欣喜。
glad: 最普通用词，语气较弱，表示礼貌的惯用语。指乐于做某事或因某事而感到满足，常表愉快的心情。
delightful: 指能带来强烈的快乐，激起愉快的情感，用于非常愉快的场合。
merry: 指精神情绪的暂时高涨，表示欢乐、愉快的心境或情景，侧重充满欢笑声和乐趣。
gay: 侧重无忧无虑、精神昂扬、充满生命的快乐。
happy: 侧重感到满足、幸福或高兴。
agreeable: 指与感受者的愿望、情趣或受好等和谐一致而带来的心情上的快意。
jolly: 通俗用词，多指充满快乐与喜悦的神情。
nice: 语气较温和，泛指任何愉快或满意的感觉。
pleasant: 侧重给人以“赏心悦目”或“愉快的，宜人的”感受。
cheerful: 多指因内心的愉快而表现出兴高采烈，是强调而自然的感情流露。



favourable, lucky, happy, fortunate

这组词都有“有利的，好运的，顺利的”的意思，其区别是：
favourable: 普通用词，指预示从良好的结果中能得到明显好处，有利于达到目的。
lucky: 多指偶然机遇中的有利或幸运情况。
happy: 侧重指不是通过某种机会，而是凭借鉴另和选择手段而得到利益与好处。有时也指偶然得到的好处，但强调的是有利的结果。
fortunate: 指目前已存在的成功或有利情况，或指因好运或机会带来的成功和喜悦。


adj. 幸福的；高兴的；巧妙的
 - pleased, glad, blessed, smart
examples: 英 ['hæpi] 美 ['hæpi]
adj.高兴的；幸福的；幸运的；乐意的

(1) I am so happy to hear of your engagement.(2) This has been the happiest day of my life.(3) I wish you a very happy future.(4) They had a very happy marriage.(5) He is in the happy position of never having to worry about money.(6) Our team would be happy to answer your questions.
(1) 听到你订婚我很高兴。(2) 这是我生活中最快乐的一天。(3) 我祝你有非常幸福的未来。(4) 他们有个幸福美满的婚姻。(5) 他真有福气，从来不需要为金钱之事操心。(6) 我们团队很乐意解答您的所有疑问。
[sound:youdao-a1dc7071-1b87b163-a9a290c2-c9d43ac7-7ebfc5f9.mp3]

translation:
n. 海港，港口; 港湾; 避难所; 藏身处
vt. &vi. 隐匿; 怀着; 包含，聚藏; 藏有
na. “harbor“的变体

时态：harboured, harbouring, harbours
分布：港口(78%)，避难所(6%)，庇护(5%)，窝藏(3%)，心怀(3%)，进入避祸所(2%)，躲藏(2%)，=harbor.(1%)


→har-, 军队，队伍，词源同 here,harry,-bour, 保护，庇护所，词源同 bury. 引申词义船只庇护地，避难所，后用于指港口。harbour 是英式拼写形式，harbor 是美式拼写形式。



US ['hɑ:r.bɚ] noun countable or uncountable  IMPROVER  ■an area of water next to the coast, often protected from the sea by a thick wall, where ships and boats can shelter 港口；港湾
•Our hotel room overlooked a pretty little fishing harbour.我们从旅馆的房间可以俯瞰一个美丽的小渔港。
 Compare dock
UK (ALSO US harbor) UK ['hɑ:.bər] US ['hɑ:r.bɚ] verb transitive HAVE IN MIND  心怀  ■to think about or feel something, usually over a long period 心怀，怀有（想法或感情）
•He's been harbouring a grudge against her ever since his promotion was refused.自从升职要求被拒绝后，他就一直对她怀恨在心。

•There are those who harbour suspicions about his motives.有人对他的动机心存怀疑。

•Powell remains non-committal about any political ambitions he may harbour.鲍威尔仍未明确表态自己胸怀何种政治抱负。

UK (ALSO US harbor) UK ['hɑ:.bər] US ['hɑ:r.bɚ] verb transitive HIDE  藏  ■to protect someone or something bad, especially by hiding them when the police are looking for them 庇护，窝藏，藏匿（罪犯或赃物）
•to harbour a criminal窝藏罪犯





port, seaport, harbour, pier, wharf

这组词都有“港，港口，码头”的意思，其区别是：
port: 多指人工港口，还可指有港口的市。
seaport: 指港埠。
harbour: 一般用词，指停泊船只、装卸货物的天然或人工港口。
pier: 专指与海岸成直角形而突出的码头，可供旅客，货物上下船或供人散步用。
wharf: 指船只停泊装卸货物的码头。



shelter, guard, harbour, safeguard, defend, shield, protect

这组词都有“保护、保卫”的意思，其区别是：
shelter: 通常指寻找安全地方躲避风雨或使人免遭危害。
guard: 普通用词，指保持警惕以防可能的攻击或伤害。
harbour: 贬义词，指隐匿或非法保护、窝藏。
safeguard: 语气强，指采取积极措施预防可能发生的一切攻击或危险。
defend: 普通用词，指用武力或其它措施使人或物不受损害，消除危险。用作比喻时，指坚持某种行动、决定或意见。
shield: 语气比protect强，但侧重防止迫在眉睫的攻击或伤害。
protect: 普通用词，指用某种手段作为防御工具以防危险或伤害。


vt. 庇护；藏匿；入港停泊
 - secrete
n. 海港（等于harbor）；避难所
 - haven, home
examples: 英 ['hɑːbə(r)] 美 ['hɑːrbər]
n.港口；避难所vt.庇护；心怀；窝藏vi.进入避祸所；躲藏=harbor.

(1) This harbour is a natural harbour.(2) We lay at anchor outside the harbour.(3) Harbour lights were blinking on the horizon.(4) He harbours a secret grudge against his father.(5) Harbouring criminals is an offence in law.(6) Crabs harbour in holes.
(1) 这个港口是天然港。(2) 我们在港外抛锚停泊。(3) 海港的灯火在水平线上闪烁着。(4) 他对父亲暗怀不满。(5) 窝藏罪犯是犯法的。(6) 蟹躲藏在洞里。

translation:
vt. 使硬化; 使经得起考验; 使无情; 使轮廓鲜明
vi. 变硬或更硬; 变稳定; 变习惯

时态：hardened, hardening, hardens
分布：动词(97%)，名词(3%)


→来自hard,硬的，-en,使。
v.(使)变硬The earth hardens under the hot sun.土地让炎热的太阳晒硬了.
【反】macerate（v 浸软）



US ['hɑ:r-] verb intransitive or transitive SOLID  凝固  ■to become or make hard （使）变硬
•The mixture hardens as it cools.混合物冷却时变硬了。

•It is thought that high cholesterol levels in the blood can harden the arteries (= make them thicker and stiffer, causing disease).据信血液中的胆固醇含量高会导致动脉硬化。

UK ['hɑ:.dən] US ['hɑ:r-] verb intransitive or transitive SEVERE  严厉  ■to become more severe, determined or unpleasant （使）变严厉，（使）变坚强，（使）变冷酷
•Living rough in the desert hardened the recruits a lot (= made them stronger).沙漠的艰苦生活把新兵锻炼得更加坚强。

•As the war progressed, attitudes on both sides hardened (= became more severe and determined).随着战争持续，双方的态度都变得更加强硬。

UK ['hɑ:.dən] US ['hɑ:r-] verb intransitive or transitive harden your heart ■to make yourself stop feeling kind or friendly towards someone 硬起心肠
•You've just got to harden your heart and tell him to leave.你只有铁了心肠让他离开。

 - stiffen
examples: 英 ['hɑːdn] 美 ['hɑːrdn]
v.(使)变硬；(使)坚强

(1) 他们把粘土坯放在炉火里使其变硬。(2) 清漆几分钟就能变硬。(3) 莱德尔太太后来说，有一位晨报的编辑帮助她，让她面对这些信件而变得坚强。(4) 艰难困苦可以使你意志坚强。

translation:
adv. 几乎不; 简直不; 刚刚; 严厉地，粗鲁地

分布：几乎不(48%)，简直不(27%)，刚刚(25%)


→hard,艰难的，-ly,副词后缀。
ad.几乎不,简直不;仅仅I can hardly pardon his discarding the hardware and cardboard in the harbour.我简直不能原谅他在港口丢弃五金和硬纸板.



US ['hɑ:rd-] adverb ONLY JUST  仅仅   ESSENTIAL  ■only just; almost not 仅仅；几乎不
•I could hardly hear her at the back.我在后面几乎听不见她说甚么。

•The party had hardly started when she left.她离开的时候派对才刚刚开始。

•He hardly ate anything/He ate hardly anything.他几乎甚么都没吃。

•We hardly ever (= almost never) go to concerts.我们几乎从不去听音乐会。

•Hardly had a moment passed before the door creaked open.没过一会儿，门就吱扭一声打开了。

UK ['hɑ:d.li] US ['hɑ:rd-] adverb CERTAINLY NOT  绝不   IMPROVER  ■certainly not 绝不
•You can hardly expect a pay rise when you've only been working for the company for two weeks!你才刚为公司工作两个星期，别指望能加薪。

•Well don't be angry with me - it's hardly my fault that it's raining!好啦，别再生我的气了——下雨又不是我的错！

UK ['hɑ:d.li] US ['hɑ:rd-] adverb   Common Learner Errors   hardlyWarning:  check your word order!Hardly  usually goes directly before the main verb in a sentence.Don't say 'hardly could/can do something', say could/can hardly do something :✗ I hardly could recognise him after so many years.I could hardly recognise him after so many years.But if the main verb is am/is/are/was  or were , hardly  usually goes directly after it:✗ There hardly were any shops in the town.There were hardly any shops in the town.




hardly, hard

hardly: 几乎不 I can hardly believe it.
hard: 努力, work hard



barely, scarcely, hardly

这组词都有“几乎不”的意思，其区别是：
barely: 指仅仅够，一点不多，强调没有多余。
scarcely: 指不太充分，不太够，不足，不能令人满意，强调数量。
hardly: 指接近最低限度，差不多没有多余，强调困难和程度。


adv. 几乎不，简直不；刚刚
 - just, ill, fresh, scarcely, barely
examples: 英 ['hɑːdli] 美 ['hɑːrdli]
adv.几乎不；简直不；刚刚

(1) Hardly anybody came.(2) He could hardly refrain himself.(3) The desert air contains hardly any moisture.(4) He is so excited that he can hardly sleep.(5) She could hardly believe her ears.(6) Hardly had the game begun when it started raining.
(1) 几乎没有人来。(2) 他几乎不能自制。(3) 沙漠的空气几乎不含一点湿气。(4) 他如此兴奋，几乎不能入睡。(5) 她简直不能相信自己的耳朵。(6) 比赛刚刚开始就下起雨来。

US [her] noun countable (plural hares or hare)■an animal like a large rabbit that can run very fast and has long ears 野兔

translation:
n. 协调; 融洽，一致; 和谐; [音]和声

分布：和谐(78%)，协调(13%)，和声(6%)，调和(3%)


→来自希腊语harmonia,和谐，一致，和音，来自ar,连接，匹配，词源同art,articulate,-mony,名词后缀，词源同alimony.
和谐[harm=fitting(适合)]
n.协调,和谐;融洽The alarm harmed the charming harmony of the ceremony.警报声损害了典礼迷人的和谐.
【反】imbroglio（n 杂乱的一团；纠葛；纷扰）；discord（n 不一致）



US ['hɑ:r-] noun MUSIC  音乐   ADVANCED  countable or uncountable ■a pleasant musical sound made by different notes being played or sung at the same time （音乐中的）和声
•singing in harmony唱和声

•It is a simple melody with complex harmonies.这是一首和声复杂的简单旋律。

UK ['hɑ:.mə.ni] US ['hɑ:r-] noun MATCH  相一致  uncountable ■when people are peaceful and agree with each other, or when things seem right or suitable together 协调；和谐，一致
•racial harmony (= good feelings between different races)种族和谐

•domestic harmony (= good feelings in the family or home)家庭和睦

•Imagine a society in which everyone lived together in (perfect) harmony.设想一下有这样一个社会，所有人都和睦地生活在一起。

•We must ensure that tourism develops in  harmony  with the environment.我们必须确保旅游业与环境和谐发展。





unity, concord, agreement, harmony, accord

这组词都有“和谐、一致”的意思，其区别是：

concord: 多指人际、国家间或民族之间协调一致的关系。
agreement: 侧重态度与观点上的一致。
harmony: 指人与人之间或不同部分与整体之间完全协调、和谐、愉快，没有摩擦。
accord: 指思想一致，彼此不矛盾，也指行动上的一致。


n. 协调；和睦；融洽；调和
 - peace, keeping

translation:
adj. 粗糙的; 刺耳的; 严厉的，严格的; 残酷的

级别：harsher, harshest
分布：刺耳的(47%)，粗糙的(45%)，大约的(4%)，使人不舒服的(4%)


→可能来自kars,刮，拔，梳理羊毛，词源同card,carduus(拉丁语，蓟),chard(多刺叶甜菜).原用于形容织物多毛的，粗糙的，引申词义残酷的，严厉的。
a.粗糙的;(声音)刺耳的;苛刻的,严酷的She was harsh to the servants.她待佣人苛刻.
【反】harshen（v 使变粗糙）－soften（v 软化）；encomium（n 赞美）－harsh criticism（严厉的批评）



US [hɑ:rʃ] adjective UNKIND  令人不快的   IMPROVER  ■unpleasant, unkind, cruel or unnecessarily severe 令人不快的；严酷的；（无端地）严厉的
•harsh criticism严厉的批评

•The children had had a harsh upbringing.孩子们的家教很严。

•We thought the punishment was rather harsh for such a minor offence.我们认为对这样的小错，这种惩罚太严酷了。

•"There is no alternative, " she said in a harsh voice.“没有选择的余地。”她用生硬的口气说道。

•He said some harsh words (= spoke unkindly) about his brother.他说了他兄弟一些难听的话。

UK [hɑ:ʃ] US [hɑ:rʃ] adjective TOO STRONG  过于强烈的   IMPROVER  ■too strong, bright, loud, etc 刺眼的；刺耳的；过于强烈的
•harsh chemicals/lighting过于刺激的化学品／刺眼的光线





hoarse, rough, harsh

这组词都有“嘶哑的，沙哑的”的意思，其区别是：
hoarse: 指嘶哑刺耳的声音，通常因高声喊叫后嗓子失音所致。
rough: 指粗哑难听的声音。
harsh: 一般多指刺耳难听的声音。



rude, crude, harsh, rough, coarse

这组词都有“粗糙的”的意思，其区别是：
rude: 指加工粗糙、不精细。也指某人的言行举止粗鲁无礼，缺乏修养。
crude: 主要指未经加工处理尚处于自然状态的物质；也可指人的言行粗鲁。
harsh: 指外表、性质、声音的粗糙、刺耳、刺目，强调使人不愉快的粗糙感。
rough: 普通用词，指某物纹理不精细，或表面凹凸不平，不光滑。
coarse: 指某物质地粗糙低劣或编织、加工等不精细、精巧。也指人的言谈举止粗鲁，不文雅。


adj. 严厉的；严酷的； [声] 刺耳的；粗糙的；刺目的

translation:
n. 收割; 收获季节; 收成; 结果
vt. & vi. 收割，收成
vt. 收到; 收割（庄稼），捕猎（动物、鱼）

时态：harvested, harvesting, harvests
分布：收获(46%)，收割(25%)，收成(25%)，成果(3%)，后果(1%)


→来自kerp,切，割，收集，词源同shear,sharp,carpel.引申词义收割粮食，果实，收获季节，秋天。
n.收获,收成;成果,后果v.收获,收割"What a marvelous carving!" the starveling harvester in vest said."好一件神奇的雕刻!"挨饿的穿着背心的收割者说.



US ['hɑ:r-] noun countable or uncountable  ADVANCED  ■the time of year when crops are cut and collected from the fields, or the activity of cutting and collecting them, or the crops which are cut and collected 收获时节；收割，收获；收成
•the grain/potato/grape harvest谷物／马铃薯／葡萄收获期

•We had a good harvest this year.今年我们收成不错。

•Farmers are reporting a bumper (= very big) harvest this year.农民说今年的收成非常好。

•It won't be long now till harvest (time).现在离收获时节不远了。

UK ['hɑ:.vɪst] US ['hɑ:r-] verb intransitive or transitive CROPS  庄稼（收获；采收物）  ■to pick and collect crops, or to collect plants, animals or fish to eat 收割，收获，捕获
•In the US, winter wheat is harvested in the early summer.在美国，冬小麦一般在初夏收割。

UK ['hɑ:.vɪst] US ['hɑ:r-] verb intransitive or transitive BODY PARTS  身体部位  ■to take cells or other body parts from someone for medical use 采集（细胞或器官以作医学用途）
•The donor organ is harvested at the accident scene and rushed to a hospital.意外现场采集的捐献器官被迅速送往医院。

•There is a lot of controversy surrounding the harvesting of stem cells.干细胞的采集备受争议。





yield, harvest, crop

这组词都有“收成”的意思，其区别是：
yield: 指生产物，农作物的总产量。
harvest: 主要指农作物或水果的收获量，有时也指收割的行为。
crop: 普通用词，侧重指农作物一次收割或一季的收成。


n. 收获；产量；结果
 - outcome, product, event, crop, result
vt. 收割；得到
 - gather, crop, net
vi. 收割庄稼
 - mow
examples: 英 ['hɑːvɪst] 美 ['hɑːrvɪst]
n.收成；收获；收割；成果；后果v.收获；收割

(1) It happened that the harvest was bad in 1988.(2) The fine summer harvest was not easily come by.(3) The harvest has been safely gathered in.(4) We are all very busy because it's the harvest time.(5) They turned the soil after the harvest.(6) We all helped the harvest.(7) The peasants are harvesting rice in the field.(8) The research yielded a rich harvest.(9) He reaped the harvest of his hard work.(10) The new medicine is the harvest of thirty years' research.(11) He should reap the harvest of his mistakes.(12) Farmers harvest their crops in fall.(13) Currently it is the high season to harvest narcissus bulbs.(14) Next week they will harvest the corn.(15) It's still too early to harvest the wheat now.(16) It's the busy time for them to harvest their fields.

(1) 碰巧一九八八年的收成很糟。(2) 夏季的好收成不是容易得来的。(3) 庄稼已妥善收获完毕。(4) 因为现在是收获期，所以我们都非常忙。(5) 他们在收获后翻耕土壤。(6) 我们都帮忙收割。(7) 农民们正在田野里收割稻子。(8) 该项研究有了丰硕的成果。(9) 他获得辛勤劳动的成果。(10) 这种新药是三十年研究的成果。(11) 他应该承受错误造成的后果。(12) 农民秋天收获庄稼。(13) 那现在正好是水仙收获的季节。(14) 他们下星期收割玉米。(15) 现在收割小麦为时过早。(16) 现在正是他们在地里收割庄稼的繁忙季节。

translation:
n. 匆忙，急忙; 急速，紧迫; 轻率
v. 赶紧，匆忙; <古>使快，催促

分布：匆忙(55%)，急忙(22%)，急速(13%)，赶快(10%)


→来自Proto-Germanic*haifstiz,冲突，争执，斗争，来自keibh,狂暴的，迅速的，可能来自skei,砍，劈，词源同scissor,shear.引申词义催促。
n.匆忙,急速;草率v.赶快;匆忙I tasted the paste in haste and cast it on the waste plaster.我匆忙品尝了浆糊然后将其丢在废泥灰上.



noun uncountable disapproving ■(too much) speed 匆忙，仓促
•Unfortunately the report was prepared in haste and contained several inaccuracies.遗憾的是，这份报告准备得有些仓促，里面有几处不准确的地方。

•[+ to infinitive] In her haste to get up from the table, she knocked over a cup.她匆忙从桌边站起来，结果碰翻了一个茶杯。

•His father had just died and he didn't want to marry with indecent haste.父亲刚刚去世，他不想太过匆忙地结婚——那样做有悖情理。

[heɪst] noun uncountable disapproving make haste old use ■hurry up 赶快，抓紧
•Make haste!快一点！

[heɪst] noun uncountable disapproving More haste less speed. UK saying ■said to mean that if you try to do things too quickly, it will take you longer in the end 欲速则不达。




haste, hurry, speed, dispatch

这组词都有“迅速，急速”的意思，其区别是：
haste: 中性词，用作褒义指动作迅速，事情做得又快又好；作贬义用时，指做事急躁，行为鲁莽，得不到预期的结果。
hurry: 指急速从事某项活动或匆忙对付一件事情，含明显慌乱的意味。
speed: 多用于褒义，指行动敏捷快速，效果好。
dispatch: 指迅速、敏捷地结事某事，强调敏捷和及时。


n. 匆忙；急忙；轻率
 - hurry, hasty indeed
vi. 匆忙；赶紧
 - hurry, rush
vt. 赶快
 - hurry up, get a move on, shake it up, snap it up
examples: 英 [heɪst] 美 [heɪst]
n.急速；急忙v.匆忙；赶快

(1) The more haste, the less speed.(2) In his haste, he forgot to bring his glasses with him.(3) She made haste to open the door.(4) They acted with precipitate haste.(5) We advised him against acting in haste.(6) She made haste to tell her mother the good news.(7) Make haste, or you will be too late.
(1) 欲速则不达。(2) 匆忙之中，他忘了带眼镜。(3) 她急忙打开门。(4) 他们鲁莽仓促地采取了行动。(5) 我们劝他不要匆忙行事。(6) 她赶快将好消息告诉她母亲。(7) 赶快，不然就太晚啦。
[sound:youdao-940a1c53-c5ad3050-fbcb0f3c-462246ea-6d93a257.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. 加速; 使加紧; 催促; 赶紧，赶快
vi. 赶快; 急忙

时态：hastened, hastening, hastens
分布：加速(67%)，赶快(17%)，催促(16%)


→来自haste,仓促，匆忙，-en,使。
促进(haste匆忙)[-en 1.表动词"变成"2.表形容词"由…制成",通常加在名词后面3.表名词"人或物"]
【参】haste（n 匆忙；急忙）【反】slow the progress of（延缓过程）；check（vt 检查；制止；阻碍）；retard（vt 延迟；阻碍）



['heɪ.sən] formal verb transitive ■You hasten something by acting in order to make it happen sooner 加快，加紧
•I was grateful for his letter which hastened the course of the enquiry.我非常感谢他的来信，这加快了调查的进展。

•There is little doubt that poor medical treatment hastened her death.毫无疑问，劣质的治疗加速了她的死亡。
[+ to infinitive] ■If you hasten to do something, you quickly do it 赶快，赶紧（做）
•The president hastened to reassure his people that he was in perfect health.总统立即解释说他的身体状况非常好，让他的人民放心。
[+ to infinitive] ■If you hasten to say something, you want to make it clear 急忙说（或澄清）
•It was an unfortunate decision and I hasten to say it had nothing to do with me.那是个令人遗憾的决定，我急忙表示那与我没有关系。

•"People round here dress so badly - except you, Justin," she hastened to add.“这儿的人穿得真不像样——除了你之外，贾斯丁。”她急忙加了一句。





accelerate, hasten, rush, hurry, speed, quicken

这组词都有“加快，使加快”的意思，其区别是：
accelerate: 着重指频率或速率运转加快。
hasten: 指由于事的紧迫性或突然性而加速。
rush: 含义与hurry相近，但显得更仓促更慌乱。
hurry: 指赶紧或匆忙地做某事或催促别人做某事，隐含草率或混乱意味。
speed: 侧重实际的快速行动。
quicken: 普通用词，指增加速度、速率。


vt. 加速；使赶紧；催促
 - crowd, soup
vi. 赶快；急忙
 - hurry up, get a move on
examples: 英 ['heɪsn] 美 ['heɪsn]
v.催促；赶快；加速

(1) Do not hasten to bid me adieu.(2) She hastened home after hearing the news.(3) Let me hasten to say that I could never do such a thing!(4) Fascism served only to hasten its destruction.(5) An electric typewriter would hasten the work .
(1) 不要告别得那样匆忙。(2) 听到这个消息后，她匆匆忙忙地回家。(3) 让我赶快说我永远不能做这样的事情！(4) 法西斯主义只是加速了它的毁灭。(5) 电动打字机会加速这项工作。
[sound:youdao-260f6c86-315cbc97-5b9c424d-9f177e94-c055e53a.mp3]

translation:
adj. 仓促完成的; 急忙的; 草率的; 轻率的

级别：hastier, hastiest
分布：轻率的(53%)，匆匆的(28%)，急忙的(19%)


→来自haste,仓促。
a.匆忙的,仓促的;草率的He realized that his hasty decision was a mistake.他意识到自己的草率决定是一次错误.
【反】characterized by deliberation（以深思熟虑为特征）；well considered（很好地考虑过的）；deliberate（adj 深思熟虑的）



adjective ■describes something that is done in a hurry, sometimes without the necessary care or thought 仓促的，轻率的
•He warned against making hasty decisions.他警告过不要仓促作出决定。

•Now let's not leap to any hasty conclusions.现在我们不要仓促得出结论。

•We saw the rain and made a hasty retreat into the bar.我们看见下雨了，于是就匆忙躲进酒吧里。

•I think perhaps we were a little hasty in judging him.我认为我们对他的评价可能有点轻率。





hasty, urgent, prompt, instant

hasty: 匆忙的，草率的
urgent: 紧迫的，紧急的
prompt: 快速的，及时的
instant: 立即的，指几乎察觉不到的时间段



hasty, quick, prompt, fast, instant, rapid, speedy, swift

hasty: 多指匆忙、草率或仓促的行动，着重缺乏深思熟虑。
quick: 特指瞬时动作，强调动作敏捷迅速；也指匆忙的行为，而不暗示速度很快。
prompt: 主要指动作迅速，毫不拖延，含“快得令人愉悦”的意味。
fast: 常指人或物持续地高速运动，强调运动的方式。
instant: 指某事很快发生或急待解决，含刻不容缓之意。
rapid: 比fast和quick正式，常指运动本身，侧重速度惊人。所指动作可能是短暂的，也可能是持续的。
speedy: 指人或物或其运动、活动时，着重极度的快捷，多含匆忙意味。
swift: 正式用词，强调非常迅速，往往含动作轻快敏捷之意。


adj. 轻率的；匆忙的；草率的；性怠的
 - brief, rushed
examples: 英 ['heɪsti] 美 ['heɪsti]
adj.匆匆的；轻率的；急忙的
(1) Some people are prone to jump to hasty conclusions.
(1) 有些人往往作出轻率的结论。
[sound:youdao-5e0f97d1-5c1946ca-f0d2bb4c-2e7218b1-cc6ce853.mp3]

translation:
n. 帽子; （帽子所表示的）职位，职务

时态：hatted, hatting, hats

→来自kadh,覆盖，保护，词源同hood,heed.引申词义帽子。
n.帽子(一般指有边的帽子)On the flat platform the bat will pat whatever hat it likes.在平坦的站台上,蝙蝠会拍打它喜欢的任何帽子.



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a covering for the head that is not part of a piece of clothing 帽子
•a straw hat草帽

•a woolly hat羊毛帽

•a wide-brimmed hat宽边帽
■used to refer to one of the various jobs or responsibilities that someone has 职位；职责
•A couple of the kitchen staff are on holiday so I'm wearing my chef's hat tonight.有几位厨师休假了，所以今晚我来掌厨。

•This is me with my manager's hat on talking.我这是以经理的身份在讲话。

[hæt] noun countable hats off to sb old-fashioned ■said to praise and thank someone for doing something helpful 向（某人）致敬，表示感谢
•Hats off to Connie for finding such a splendid venue for a party!感谢康妮找到了这个理想的派对场地！

[hæt] noun countable take your hat off to sb ■If you say that you take your hat off to someone, you mean that you admire them for an achievement 向（某人）脱帽致敬
•So Emma actually manages to juggle two small children and a full-time job, does she? Well, I take my hat off to her.这么说艾玛在照顾好两个小孩子的同时还做着一份全职工作，是吗？我可真佩服她。

[hæt] noun countable throw your hat into the ring ■to announce your intention of entering a competition or election 宣布参赛；宣布参选




cap, hat

这组词都有“帽子”的意思，其区别是：
cap: 指无边的便帽，呀表示职业的帽子，如运动帽、军帽等。
hat: 指有边的帽子，尤指礼帽。


n. 帽子
 - cap, chapeau, titfer
examples: 英 [hæt] 美 [hæt]
n.帽子vt.给 ... 戴帽子vi.提供帽子；制造帽子

(1) She bought a hat yesterday.(2) He took off the hat and revealed his bald head.(3) He always wears a panama hat.(4) The magician conjured a rabbit out of his hat.(5) She is wearing a pert little hat.(6) The young lady was beautifully dressed and hatted.
(1) 她昨天买了一顶帽子。(2) 他脱下帽子，露出秃头。(3) 他总戴着一顶巴拿马草帽。(4) 魔术师从他的帽子里变出一只兔子。(5) 她头戴一顶小巧别致的帽子。(6) 那位小姐身着漂亮衣服, 头戴华丽帽子。

vt. & vi. 孵化; 孵出，破壳而出
vt. 秘密策划，（尤指）密谋; 使（小鸟、小鱼、小虫等）孵出
n. （船甲板或飞机底部装货物的）舱口; 开口; （飞机或宇宙飞船的）舱门; （尤指厨房和餐厅之间供传递食物的）两室之间的小窗口

→词源不详。hatch 舱门，盖子

verb EGG  蛋  intransitive or transitive ■to (cause an egg to) break in order to allow a young animal to come out 孵出；孵蛋；出壳
[hætʃ] verb PLAN  计划  transitive ■to make a plan, especially a secret plan 策划（尤指秘密计划）
•It was in August of 1978 that the Bolton brothers hatched their plot to kill their parents.那是在1978年的8月，博尔顿兄弟策划了杀害他们父母的计划。

[hætʃ] noun countable (also hatchway) ■an opening through a wall, floor, etc., or the cover for it （墙、地板等上的）开口；活板门；盖子
•an escape hatch逃生出口

•a serving hatch上菜窗口

[hætʃ] noun countable (also hatchway) Down the hatch! informal saying ■said before swallowing a drink, especially an alcoholic one 干杯！



n. 孵化； [船]  [航] 舱口

(1) 白颊山雀孵化的时间，似乎在孵化前一个月，也就是下蛋时便已决定。(2) 两个人很快从舱口下去不见了。(3) 孵卵器用来孵小鸡。(4) 雄性离开雌性去孵蛋和寻找食物。(5) 小鸡正从蛋壳里孵出来。(6) 鸡蛋需要21天才孵化。(7) 那些孩子在琢磨什么鬼花样?

n. 霍克; 鹰; 鹰派人物，主战派; 掠夺别人的人，骗子

分布：鹰(85%)，清嗓(5%)，沿街叫卖(4%)，放鹰行猎(2%)，鹰派人物、主战分子(1%)，贪婪的人(1%)，鹰扑(1%)，散布(1%)


→来自中古英语havek,来自kap,抓住，词源同have,heave,capable.后用于指猛禽鹰或隼。
n.鹰,隼The lawyer's son-in-law likes hawk's claws and jaws.律师的女婿喜欢鹰爪和下颌.
【记】读：好客－好客的小贩才会叫卖【参】falcon（n 猎鹰）fall下来就can吃到东西aquiline（adj 鹰的；象鹰的）一去一条线



US [hɑ:k] noun countable BIRD  鸟  ■a type of large bird which catches small birds and animals for food 鹰
UK [hɔ:k] US [hɑ:k] noun countable PERSON  人  ■a person who strongly supports the use of force in political relationships rather than discussion or other more peaceful solutions （主张采取强硬政治路线的）鹰派人物 Compare dove

noun uncountable ■grass which is cut, dried and used as animal food or as covering material （用作饲料或覆盖物的）干草
